intro: Clermontia glabra, commonly known as the smooth clermonthe, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and streamside areas. It has smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to habitat loss, Clermontia glabra is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts in Hawaii.
